Indentation in Python

Jan 17, 2020

what is indentation:

According to wikipedia - indentation indent is an empty space at the beginning of a line to signal the start of a new paragraph.

In some programming language e.g python indentation expresses how a control structure should behave, making changes to the indentation changes the codeâ€™s behavior, python uses indentation to indicate a block of code (a group of statement)

Examples

 if 5 > 2:
    print("five is greater than two!")   	

 name = "David"
 
 if len(name) > 0:
     message = 'name is not empty'
     print(message)

python version used : python 3.7.3
